positions.description_html:
Translated I into We

Recruitment of the team, delegated the work, supervised and mentored juniors, strategised content and managed the team. Apart from this, I did documentation and planning of everything happening in the front and backend of the club.

Responsible for all the important decisions and operations done in the team.

positions.subtitle: Samarthya
positions.description: It is the only electronics club of my campus. It regularly organizes technical events, workshops all around the year.  It also organizes an annual technical fest Pinnacle. I have been part of the fest for two years and worked mainly as a  graphic designer for the team. Other than that I have planned the events, managed and convinced the crowd for the same. Most important learning that I have gained while working for this club is how your idea gets enhanced when it becomes the team's idea.

experience.title: Research Intern
experience.description: Worked for writing a research paper for LoResMT conference. We basically tested different ML techniques for English to Marathi Machine Translation model. The data was provided by the LoResMT.I mainly worked on the encoder decoder based model training using LSTM. And was involved in writing the literature review for the same.
experience.description_html: Worked for writing a research paper for LoResMT conference. We basically tested different ML techniques for English to Marathi Machine Translation model. recommendations: DivyaSree K S “I have been working with Ismirti from her internship time with Deloitte and I am highly impressed with her creative problem solving skills and work ethics. She has consistently demonstrated a remarkable ability to take initiatives and drive the same forward with high passion. She possess good analytical and presentation skills, and is always open to new ideas, feedbacks and showed a strong desire to learn and grow. As she is starting her career, I can clearly see her interest in learning and taking up new challenges which will definitely make her an asset to any team ! Best wishes Ismriti.”

volunteer_experience.info: Learn with Comics( is India's First  Non-Profit Educational Comic Start-Up. They distribute the comics to different schools and other educational organizations. I designed three comics taking physics as a subject for class 6th and explained concepts called reflection, lightning, and magnetism. Apart from this, I translated three class 6th Chemistry comics into Hindi for regional language students.

volunteer_experience.info:
In Crio Summer Of Doing, student developers build real products in a work-like environment called Micro-Experience, set up by Crio.Do. I completed five micro experiences as the part of the program, viz, HTTP(), REST, Linux Basics, Deploying app server in aws, Git basics, HTML and CSS, QPrep Javascript and QProfile.I also made my portfolio website and a distributed system backend for food order platform, QEats, with Java Spring Boot and MongoDB.A personal portfolio website…

          In Crio Summer Of Doing, student developers build real products in a work-like environment called Micro-Experience, set up by Crio.Do. I completed five micro experiences as the part of the program, viz, HTTP(), REST, Linux Basics, Deploying app server in aws, Git basics, HTML and CSS, QPrep Javascript and QProfile.I also made my portfolio website and a distributed system backend for food order platform, QEats, with Java Spring Boot and MongoDB.A personal portfolio website created from Crio.Do's full stack introduction Micro Experience - QProfile

projects: [{"title":"HypeIt- Influencer Marketing Platform.","start_date":"Mar 2021","end_date":"Mar 2021","description":"Github link: https://github.com/Ismriti12/HypeIt-Influencer-Marketing-PlatformResponsible for: Front end and Project ManagementHYPEIT is a web-based platform to promote the influencer marketing industry in our country. The motive behind making this platform was to provide a structure to this unorganized sector. It is a software solution designed to assist brands with their Influencer Marketing Campaigns. Influencer Marketing Platforms provide influencer discovery tools for brands and agencies, some also offer massive searchable databases of potential influencers, using clever algorithms. Brands begin by creating and defining their campaign, being as specific and detailed as possible. They then search for influencers. With the Self-Serve plan, the search runs very much like any other influencer marketplace. Creators can pitch to brands directly for their campaigns by offering their respective gigs."},{},{},{},{"title":"UI/UX Design of a Digital Detox App","start_date":"Mar 2021","end_date":"Mar 2021","description":"This app promotes digital minimalism by stimulating the power of decision making of an individual. For more information, kindly see the project."},{"title":"UI/UX Design of a Gardening Community App","start_date":"Jan 2021","end_date":"Jan 2021","description":"This project was made under a IITG competition DFRAME. We were given a problem statement about gardening community bonding and we have to conceptualize and design that. We won this hackathon!You can see the complete project at: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fc0wi8usc8S2sVmvqw8aRxnva2in8OK5/view?usp=sharing"},{},{"title":"UI/UX Design of an E-Commerce website","start_date":"Dec 2020","end_date":"Dec 2020","description":"In this project, I designed an e-commerce website for the selling of second-hand goods at my campus."},{"title":"Name Gender Prediction using sound","start_date":"Nov 2020","end_date":"Nov 2020","description":"Analyze the gender distribution of children's book writers and use sound to match names to gender. We know that the same name can be spelt out in many ways (for example, Marc and Mark, or Elizabeth and Elisabeth). Therefore, sound can be a better way to match names than spelling. In this project, I have used the Python package Fuzzy to find out the genders of authors that have appeared in the New York Times Best Seller list for Children's Picturebooks.First, using fuzzy (sound) name matching, I have searched for author names in a dataset provided by the US Social Security Administration that contains names and genders of all individuals who have applied for Social Security Cards(the dataset). And then aggregate the author dataset by including gender. Finally, I plotted the gender distribution of children's picture books authors over time."},{"title":"The Hottest topics in Machine Learning","start_date":"Nov 2020","end_date":"Nov 2020","description":"Used Natural Language Processing on NIPS papers to uncover the trendiest topics in machine learning research."},{"title":"University Admission Prediction Using Multiple Linear Regression","start_date":"Oct 2020","end_date":"Oct 2020"},{"title":"Twitter sentiment analysis","start_date":"Sep 2020","end_date":"Oct 2020","description":"Using Natural Language Processing techniques, sentiment analysis of twitter tweets was done, i,e. the model tests whether the tweets are positive or negative. A Naive Bayes classifier was trained to predict sentiment from thousands of Twitter tweets(31962). I cleaned the data by removing punctuation marks, stop words and by performing Count Vectorization (Tokenization).This project was under the guided project of Coursera. https://www.coursera.org/account/accomplishments/certificate/F5AJUP4ZSLPS"},{"title":"Seminar on Air Traffic Management","start_date":"Aug 2019","end_date":"Oct 2019"},{"title":"Tiny House","start_date":"Feb 2019","end_date":"Feb 2019"},{}]
